page.title: 15TRANSPORT ON RHUM
page.content: {Landrovers}are the main transport on Rhum as the roads are unsuitable for cars. {Ponies}are used for carrying culled deer and for riding. When people are tree planting on the hills the{buggy}is used. This small vehicle has eight plump, wide tyres and is ideal for covering rough ground. The Castle uses a{minibus}to collect guests and their luggage from the pier. {Bikes}are used by some, mainly around the village. {Tractors}are used to carry hay for feeding the ponies and{trailers}are attached when any heavy loads have to be carried.
